text: <@U2AF9V8QK>  are you using CLI or SDK?
<@U2F309084|thegooders> has joined the channel
the register user request must be signed by the registrar's enrollment key, if the client does not have that, it cannot register a new user with this registrar
I would suggest you clean your db using ```rm -rf /var/hyperledger/production/``` and then enroll admin before registering a new user
<@U1Y2R5C9L>   well… I’m trying to integrate the CA’s grpc service with my own golang codes <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/API/MemberServicesAPI/>
<@U1Y2R5C9L>  ok, I’ll try to clean the db. thanks for your reply :grimacing:

so when you enrolled the admin, did you receive the enrollment certs? you should save them and when using admin as registrar to register the new user, please use this key to sign the request for create user
you can have a look at the <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R5RtIBMW9fZpli37E5Li5_Q9ve3BnQ4q3gWmGZj6Sv4/edit#heading=h.z6ne0og04bp5> for more details about this process
the Spec is still under development, but you'll get the idea
of course after every unsuccessfull attempt, you'll need to clean your db because a user cannot be enrolled or registered twice

<@U2AF9V8QK|shimron> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/shimron/F2F36U5NJ/pasted_image_at_2016_09_23_03_43_pm.png|Pasted image at 2016-09-23, 3:43 PM> and commented: <@U1Y2R5C9L> it seems the membersrvc create a new token for admin, but it also gave me another error

initial_comment.comment: <@U1Y2R5C9L> it seems the membersrvc create a new token for admin, but it also gave me another error

text: The new token is the challenge you are supposed to decrypt and then send a new request after signing the request with signing key. It looks like you didn't sign the request with correct key. I would suggest you take a look at the spec
it has code examples to solve the problem
<@U1Y2R5C9L>  thanks a lot,  I’ll check it  :grimacing:
<@U2AF9V8QK> No problem. Please do come back and ask questions if you still face any problems
<@U1Y2R5C9L> I’ll be back:grinning:
<@U2F59CB0A|waqasburney> has joined the channel

Hi all,  I'm new to hyperledger and we are trying to test out the marbles (and other) demos.  We have a hyperledger network running on a Mac and also on a POWER8 machine.  We are using the fabric docker implementation.  We can deploy chaincode to the networks just fine in chaincodedev mode, but in standard mode we get errors when we try to deploy code.  It looks like it can't start the container for the chaincode.  See output below.  If anyone else has had this problem, we would love some help :slightly_smiling_face:  
```
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.383 [chaincode] getArgsAndEnv -> DEBU 12f Executable is /opt/gopath/bin/05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.383 [chaincode] Deploy -> DEBU 130 deploying chaincode 05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364(networkid:dev,peerid:vp0)
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.384 [container] lockContainer -> DEBU 131 waiting for container(dev-vp0-05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364) lock
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.384 [container] lockContainer -> DEBU 132 got container (dev-vp0-05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364) lock
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.385 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO 133 Error building images: dial unix /var/run/docker.sock: connect: no such file or directory
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.385 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO 134 Image Output:
vp0_1         | ********************
vp0_1         | 
```

and as a result we then get:
```
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.390 [dockercontroller] createContainer -> DEBU 141 Create container: dev-vp0-05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.390 [dockercontroller] Start -> ERRO 142 start-could not recreate container Post <http://unix.sock/containers/create?name=dev-vp0-05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364>: dial unix /var/run/docker.sock: connect: no such file or directory
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.390 [container] unlockContainer -> DEBU 143 container lock deleted(dev-vp0-05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364)
vp0_1         | 10:59:17.390 [chaincode] Launch -> ERRO 144 launchAndWaitForRegister failed Error starting container: Post <http://unix.sock/containers/create?name=dev-vp0-05f77a855f979ae213b1700e87f61d93ee19bae3e9aaf4531fecd3d900641afad15c49e7fcf1244318310aee62af43ad305b6ac4db326352afdb7edb6f969364>: dial unix /var/run/docker.sock: connect: no such file or directory
```
<@U2F59NX6U|bacharif> has joined the channel
<@U2F5G34MN|rwilting> has joined the channel
you need to mount the `/var/run/docker.sock` as a volume for your peer container
<@U2F4MDMCK|tekniq> has joined the channel
<@U2F6TH5PB|blbrech> has joined the channel
<@U2F704725|dungor> has joined the channel
<@U2F87HGNS|adamgor> has joined the channel
Something has changed on the home page that removed the link under Community that let you see the wiki page with all the community information (lists, wg meetings, etc.).

Thank <@U0PB67X4K>  :grinning: added 
```
  volumes:
    - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock
```
into our docker-compose.yml file for the peer and it worked perfectly!

I was curious if anyone within Hyperledger community is working on an orchestration mechanism that would allow to easily set up the entire network through a series of simple questions, close to what Microsoft announced during DEVCON2 for its private Ethereum network offering. Bluemix does it partially - it sets up a network but it does not give much of flexibility with regards to the deployment options
